availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph A. Moss (Green County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Green County, Kentucky, native. Married to Hannah R. Bullock Moss in Barren County, Kentucky, in September 1835. Father of John M. Moss, Francis C. Moss, George M. Moss, Julian A. Moss, Louisa E. Moss, Judea E. Moss, Mary C. Moss, and Mariah B. Moss. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Green County in 1860.

Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954, Genealogical Society of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT, Barren County Marriages, Film 000209753.
